qas.question: Until the 1980s, when had an American film last been shot in Shanghai?
Who starred in 'Empire of the Sun'?

answers.text: John Malkovich and a young Christian Bale

qas.question: Who thought 'Empire of the Sun' was the best film of the year?
What was Spielberg's role on 'Batteries Not Included'?
Before Empire of the Sun what was the last American movie shot in Shanghai?
Who was nominated for an Oscar for Empire of the Sun?
In what year did the novel Empire of the Sun get released?
What was Christian  Bale's first movie?

context: In <b8_0>1987<b8_0/>, as China began opening to Western capital investment, Spielberg shot the first American film in <b5_0>Shanghai<b5_0/> since <a0_0>the 1930s<a0_0/>, an adaptation of <a1_0>J. G. Ballard<a1_0/>'s autobiographical novel <b9_0>Empire of the Sun<b9_0/>, starring <a2_0><b7_0>John Malkovich<b7_0/> and a young Christian Bale<a2_0/>. The film garnered much praise from critics and was nominated for several Oscars, but did not yield substantial box office revenues. Reviewer <a3_0>Andrew Sarris<a3_0/> called it the best film of the year and later included it among the best films of the decade. Spielberg was also a <a4_0>co-producer<a4_0/> of the 1987 film *<b6_0>batteries not included<b6_0/>.
